description: Nice app for getting info about btrfs volumes, but would be nice to have a "Copy" to clipboard button next to the UUID and other things. Kind of pointless otherwise to provide such info and require you to manually write it down.
This is a pretty good application for restoring btrfs subvolumes of your choosing. More versatile than Timeshift.
"You have lots of space, did you overbuy?" -- seriously???? This guy thinks he's my father or something??? Was it really neccessary to put this there???

This is my favorite BTRFS tool.
 
I used to use Timeshift but I find this to be a better alternative since it does almost everything Timeshift does minus the subvolume layout stuff, so I can use it on default Fedora btrfs layouts wihtout problems and it even has a few extra options/functions, which is very nice. Give it a try
Much easier to understand the structure of BTRFS using this utility. Thanks!
